title: Security Policy
text: believe found security vulnerability repositories organization, please report us coordinated disclosure. Please report security vulnerabilities public GitHub issues, discussions, pull requests. Instead, please send email vulnerability.management[@]roche.com. Please include much information listed can help us better understand resolve issue: type issue (e.g., buffer overflow, SQL injection, cross-site scripting) Full paths source file(s) related manifestation issue location affected source code (tag/branch/commit direct URL) special configuration required reproduce issue Step--step instructions reproduce issue Proof--concept exploit code (possible) Impact issue, including attacker might exploit issue information help us triage report quickly.

title: The `adam_db` argument
text: remove ADSL variables database non-ADSL datasets merge ADSL variables back needed. Note keys defined data analysis plan Roche.
code: library(chevron) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'tern': #>   method   from  #>   tidy.glm broom library(dm) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dm' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter  syn_data <- syn_test_data()[c("adsl", "adae", "adlb", "adrs", "adsub")]  drop_adsl_vars <- function(df, adsl) {   df[c("USUBJID", "STUDYID", setdiff(names(df), names(adsl)))] }  dbl <- c(list(adsl = syn_data$adsl), lapply(syn_data[-1], drop_adsl_vars, adsl = syn_data$adsl))  ### Define primary and foreign keys adam_study_data <- new_dm(dbl) %>%   dm_add_pk(adsl, c("USUBJID", "STUDYID")) %>%   dm_add_fk(adae, c("USUBJID", "STUDYID"), ref_table = "adsl") %>%   dm_add_pk(adae, c("USUBJID", "STUDYID", "ASTDTM", "AETERM", "AESEQ")) %>%   dm_add_fk(adlb, c("USUBJID", "STUDYID"), ref_table = "adsl") %>%   dm_add_pk(adlb, c(     "STUDYID", "USUBJID", "PARAMCD", "BASETYPE", "AVISITN",     "ATPTN", "DTYPE", "ADTM", "LBSEQ", "ASPID"   )) %>%   dm_add_fk(adrs, c("USUBJID", "STUDYID"), ref_table = "adsl") %>%   dm_add_pk(adrs, c("STUDYID", "USUBJID", "PARAMCD", "AVISITN", "ADTM", "RSSEQ")) %>%   dm_add_fk(adsub, c("USUBJID", "STUDYID"), ref_table = "adsl") %>%   dm_add_pk(adsub, c("USUBJID", "STUDYID", "PARAMCD"))  validate_dm(adam_study_data) #> Warning: `validate_dm()` was deprecated in dm 0.3.0. #> Please use `dm_validate()` instead.

title: The .study Argument
text: Used specify actual arm study. - default: ACTARM.

title: The .study Argument
text: Used DMT01, list variables summarized.

title: The .study Argument
text: Used DMT01, labels list variables summarized.

title: The .study Argument
text: Used EGT01, LBT01 VST01 variables capture status evolution analysis. - default: c("AVAL", "CNG")

title: The .study Argument
text: label associated variables selected evo_vars.

title: The .study Argument
text: Used DST01 define reason patient withdrawal. - default: DCSREAS

title: The .study Argument
text: Used AET04 put correspondence severity levels labels.

title: The .study Argument
text: used everywhere, label associated overall column.

title: The .study Argument
text: Used AET01 medical concept variables summarized. - default: c("SMQ01", "SMQ02", "CQ01").

title: The .study Argument
text: Used specify planned arm study. - default: ARM.

title: The .study Argument
text: used DST01, name column specifying study withdrawal): - default: DCSREAS.

title: The .study Argument
text: Used AET01 safety variables summarized. - default c("FATAL", "SER", "SERWD", "SERDSM", "RELSER", "WD", "DSM", "REL", "RELWD", "RELDSM", "SEV").

title: The .study Argument
text: internal, used AET03, capture levels severity adverse events: generally corresponds levels AESEVin adae.

text: Used DST01 define patient status. - default: EOSSTT

title: Layouts in Chevron
text: chevron R package collection functions create standard tables, listings, graphs (TLGs). functions referred chevron TLG-functions. subset TLG-functions create tables. Tables created using rtables package. rtables context table layouts, .e.¬†pre-data table cell-derivation instructions. example: layout contain cell-value derivation information can used reused different data Hence layouts define table pre-data. , layout functions chevron never take data argument. Note pruning sorting currently performed layout space rtables rather actual table objects. Also, layouts allow certain queries variables required build table using given layout: chevron creating tables always explicit layout creation *_lyt functions. example aet02_1 layout function: Note aet02_1_lyt function returns concise description tern rtables can used create cell values tables. table creation function use *_lyt function builds table using build_table data given adam_db shown next:
code: library(rtables) #> Loading required package: magrittr #> Loading required package: formatters  lyt <- basic_table() %>%   split_cols_by("ARM") %>%   analyze("AGE", mean)  lyt #> A Pre-data Table Layout #>  #> Column-Split Structure: #> ARM (lvls)  #>  #> Row-Split Structure: #> AGE (** analysis **) adsl <- data.frame(   ARM = factor(sample(c("ARM A", "ARM B"), 100, TRUE)),   AGE = runif(100, 20, 90),   COUNTRY = factor(sample(c("CHN", "USA", "BRA", "RUS"), 100, TRUE)) )  build_table(lyt, adsl) #>             ARM A             ARM B       #> Default `ONGOING. discontinued_lbl (string) associated discontinued study found columns given status. Default DISCONTINUED. ... used.
